If -nocomplain is specified as the first argument, any possible errors are suppressed. The option may not be abbreviated, in order to disambiguate it from possible variable names. The option -- indicates the end of the options, and should be used if you wish to remove a variable with the same name as any of the options. If an error occurs during variable deletion, any variables after the named one causing the error are not deleted. An error can occur when the named variable does not exist, or the name refers to an array element but the variable is a scalar, or the name refers to a variable in a non-existent namespace.

trans-unit.source: contains an element with the same name as the font. If there is such an element, then the font information contained in that element is used in the Postscript. Otherwise Tk attempts to guess what Postscript font to use. Tk's guesses generally only work for well-known fonts such as Times and Helvetica and Courier, and only if the X font name does not omit any dashes up through the point size. For example, -*-Courier-Bold-R-Normal--*-120-* will work but *Courier-Bold-R-Normal*120* will not; Tk needs the dashes to parse the font name).

trans-unit.source: contains spaces like "a::b::foo bar baz", then additional words like "bar" and "baz" are treated as sub-ensembles. Sub-ensembles are merely parts within an ensemble; they do not have a Tcl command associated with them. An ensemble like "foo" can have a sub-ensemble called "foo bar", which in turn can have a sub-ensemble called "foo bar baz". In this case, the sub-ensemble "foo bar" must be created before the sub-ensemble "foo bar baz" that resides within it.

trans-unit.source: field is given to the remote application. Without the -binary option all data will be sent in unicode. For dde clients which don't implement the CF_UNICODE clipboard format, this will automatically be translated to the system encoding. You can use the -binary option in combination with the result of encoding convertto to send data in any other encoding.
trans-unit.target: フィールドはリモートアプリケーションに与えられます。-binaryオプションを指定しないと、すべてのデータがUnicodeで送信されます。CF_UNICODEクリップボード形式を実装していないddeクライアントの場合、これは自動的にシステムエンコーディングに変換されます。-binaryオプションをconverttoのエンコード結果と組み合わせて使用して、他のエンコードでデータを送信できます。

trans-unit.source: field is populated. This is highly unlikely to be useful to Tcl scripts, as Tcl's internal encoding is not strict UTF-8, but rather a modified CESU-8 with a denormalized NUL (identical to that used in a number of places by Java's serialization mechanism) to enable basic processing with non-Unicode-aware C functions. As this representation should only ever be used by Tcl's implementation, the number of bytes used to store the representation is of very low value (except to C extension code, which has direct access for the purpose of memory management, etc.)
trans-unit.target: フィールドが埋められています。Tclの内部エンコーディングは厳密なUTF-8ではなく、むしろ非ユニコード対応のC関数での基本的な処理を可能にするために、非正規化されたNUL(Javaのシリアライズ機構で多くの場所で使用されているものと同じ)を持つCESU-8を修正したものなので、これはTclスクリプトにとって有用である可能性は非常に低いです。この表現はTclの実装によってのみ使用されるべきものであるため、表現を格納するために使用されるバイト数は非常に低い価値を持っています(メモリ管理などの目的で直接アクセスできるCの拡張コードを除いて)。

trans-unit.source: focus model by default. Moving the mouse within a top-level does not normally change the focus; the focus changes only when a widget decides explicitly to claim the focus (e.g., because of a button click), or when the user types a key such as Tab that moves the focus.
trans-unit.target: フォーカスモデルがデフォルトで使用されています。通常、トップレベル内でマウスを移動してもフォーカスは変わりません。フォーカスが変わるのは、ウィジェットが明示的にフォーカスを主張することを決定した場合(ボタンクリックなど)や、ユーザーが Tab などのキーを入力してフォーカスを移動させた場合のみです。

trans-unit.source: focus model: it reconfigures Tk so that the focus is set to a window whenever the mouse enters it. The Tcl procedures tk_focusNext and tk_focusPrev implement a focus order among the windows of a top-level; they are used in the default bindings for Tab and Shift-Tab, among other things.
trans-unit.target: フォーカスモデル：Tkを再構成して、マウスがウィンドウに入るとフォーカスがウィンドウに設定されるようにします。Tclプロシージャtk_focusNextおよびtk_focusPrevは、トップレベルのウィンドウ間のフォーカス順序を実装します。これらは、TabやShift-Tabなどのデフォルトのバインディングで使用されます。

trans-unit.source: for identifying, inserting and deleting subsets of their coordinates. Indices are used for commands such as inserting or deleting a range of characters or coordinates, and setting the insertion cursor position. An index may be specified in any of a number of ways, and different types of items may support different forms for specifying indices. Text items support the following forms for an index; if you define new types of text-like items, it would be advisable to support as many of these forms as practical. Note that it is possible to refer to the character just after the last one in the text item; this is necessary for such tasks as inserting new text at the end of the item. Lines and Polygons do not support the insertion cursor and the selection. Their indices are supposed to be even always, because coordinates always appear in pairs.

trans-unit.source: gives the x-coordinate of the positioning point on the Postscript page, using any of the forms allowed for -pageheight. Used in conjunction with the -pagey and -pageanchor options to determine where the printed area appears on the Postscript page. Defaults to the center of the page.
trans-unit.target: -pageheightで許可されている任意の形式を使用して、Postscriptページ上の位置決めポイントのx座標を指定します。-pageyおよび-pageanchorオプションと一緒に使用して、Postscriptページのどこに印刷領域が表示されるかを決定します。デフォルトはページの中央です。

trans-unit.source: gives the y-coordinate of the positioning point on the Postscript page, using any of the forms allowed for -pageheight. Used in conjunction with the -pagex and -pageanchor options to determine where the printed area appears on the Postscript page. Defaults to the center of the page.
trans-unit.target: -pageheightで許可されている任意の形式を使用して、Postscriptページ上の位置決めポイントのy座標を指定します。-pagexおよび-pageanchorオプションと一緒に使用して、Postscriptページの印刷領域が表示される場所を決定します。デフォルトはページの中央です。

trans-unit.source: glob — Return names of files that match patterns
trans-unit.target: glob —パターンに一致するファイルの名前を返す
global —グローバル変数にアクセスします

trans-unit.source: grab — Confine pointer and keyboard events to a window sub-tree
trans-unit.target: grab —ポインターおよびキーボードイベントをウィンドウサブツリーに限定する
